intro: Actephila nitidula, commonly known as the glossy actephila, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its smooth, shiny leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its flowers are small and usually white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Actephila nitidula is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in temperate regions.
